comment: Dr. Larrotta is by far the best CJ Spanish teacher. She is very easy going and is helpful in every way possible. Though attendance is not mandatory, you will would not want to miss a class. Take her she is the best!

A little unsure of herself when activities fall outside the text or worksheets provided by dept curriculum, and sometimes doesn't explain things the best, but she tries and is very helpful. Suggestions to do something not on the syllabus are outright rejected, though. Cute, though, and maybe in a few years she will become more flexible and savvy.

Native Speaker--Her English is excellent though she speaks mostly Spanish is the 2002 class.  She is a great Spanish Professor especially if you are interested in learning the language.  She is tough and I feel like more years will season her with more wisdom in teaching...feel like she needs that to make her even better than she is.
